heisig_chinese_memo: Ok, sorry to be crude... if you claw at a girls melons, she is gonna give you the elbow.
heisig_story: The only thing that distinguishes this from the claw is the addition of the elbow, made by doubling up the third stroke and adding a fourth.

WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The melon radical and the melon kanji are exactly the same! Wahoo!
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Make sure you remember this radical means melon and you'll remember the kanji meaning too!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: What's the best use for a melon? Not eating it, but running over it in your car (ã‹)! Melons make a nice big splat sound when you drive over them, and that's what you plan to do to every melon you see.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine hitting the gas pedal in your car as you head for a big melon. Watch it burst into a million pieces as your car makes contact, hurling melon bits all over your windshield. It's a melon firework!

humanum_full_description_en:
" Melon " in the golden inscription has the shape of melons growing on the vines. " Melon " is a plant of the Cucurbitaceae family. The original meaning is the " melon " of melons and fruits. "Said Wen": "Melon, ã¼Œ also. Pictogram. All melons belong to melon." Duan Yucai changed "ã¼Œ" to "è“", and noted: "In the wood, it is the fruit, in the ground it is the è“. It is also the one who is born on the earth." Xu Kaiyun: "The outside looks like its vines, but the middle one is actually."

Bronze "Minggua" is used as a compound surname, namely "Linghu" in classics. Linghu Monarch Pot: "Order (order) melon (fox) monarch milk (ru) Zizha (make) cast statue pot". See " Fox ". It is also used as " solitary " to mean the " solitary " of the guqing , that is, the high official of the imperial court. Here it refers to Yin Ziyu, the commander of the Chu army in the battle of Chengpu, who committed the bell: "Master of Sangjue, kill Juegua (solitary)", Refers to the loss of his army and the killing of his commander (Qiu Xigui).

Later generations " melon " is another weapon with a long handle and a melon-shaped upper end. "The Romance of the Three Kingdoms" Chapter 119: "The warrior beat Zhang Jie Luangua to death at His Royal Highness." " Melon " in Cantonese can mean death, which may come from this. It may also be derived from the term "winter melon tofu". The Cantonese "winter melon tofu" means very fragile, which is extended to be an unlucky thing, which is similar to "three long and two short".
humanum_short_description_en: Synopsis: The " melon " in the golden inscription has melons and fruits on the vines. The original meaning is melon and fruit.

" Melon" in the golden inscription has the shape of melons growing on the vines. " Melon" is a plant of the Cucurbitaceae family. The original meaning is the " melon" of melons and fruits. "Said Wen": "Melon, ã¼Œ also. Pictogram. All melons belong to melon." Duan Yucai changed " ã¼Œ" to " è“", and noted: "In the wood, it is the fruit, in the ground it is the è“. It is also the one who is born on the earth." Xu Kaiyun: "The outside looks like its vines, but the middle one is actually." Bronze "Minggua" is used as a compound surname, namely "Linghu" in classics. Linghu Monarch Pot: "Order (order) melon (fox) monarch milk (ru) Zizha (make) cast statue pot". See " Fox". It is also used as " solitary" to mean the " solitary" of the guqing, that is, the high official of the imperial court. Here it refers to Yin Ziyu, the commander of the Chu army in the battle of Chengpu, who committed the bell: "Master of Sangjue, kill Juegua (solitary)", Refers to the loss of his army and the killing of his commander (Qiu Xigui). Later generations " melon" is another weapon with a long handle and a melon-shaped upper end. "The Romance of the Three Kingdoms" Chapter 119: "The warrior beat Zhang Jie Luangua to death at His Royal Highness." " Melon" in Cantonese can mean death, which may come from this. It may also be derived from the term "winter melon tofu". The Cantonese "winter melon tofu" means very fragile, which is extended to be an unlucky thing, which is similar to "three long and two short".

melon
Basic explanation of words
melon
guÄ
A trailing plant belonging to the Cucurbitaceae family. Edible fruit: watermelon. Winter melon. Guardy. Divide (divide like a melon, such as "guaguatianxia"). connection. Guadai. Melon plum (referring to the suspected situation). melon seeds.
melon
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[â‘ ]ï¼»guÄï¼½
["Guangyun" Gu Huaqie, Pingma, see you. ]
Also known as "è‹½2".
(1) Cucurbitaceae plants. There are many types. Fruits can be used as vegetables or fruits, and some can also be used as miscellaneous grains and feed. Also refers to the fruits of such plants.
(2) Refers to objects such as melon-shaped ornaments, guards of honor, and weapons.
(3) Refers to the ripeness of the melon.
(4) Scrape.
(5) Yu silly.
(6) Through "snail".
melon

melon
Source glyph
melon
Name meaning
Cucurbitaceae. Trailing, palmately leaves. The fruit can be eaten or used for medicinal purposes. Later it is extended to the meaning of dividing and so on.

Radicals: ç“œ  (melon)
Meaning Mnemonic
The melon radical and the melon kanji are exactly the same! Wahoo!
Make sure you remember this radical means melon and you'll remember the kanji meaning too!
Reading Mnemonic
What's the best use for a melon? Not eating it, but running over it in your car (ã‹)! Melons make a nice big splat sound when you drive over them, and that's what you plan to do to every melon you see.
Imagine hitting the gas pedal in your car as you head for a big melon. Watch it burst into a million pieces as your car makes contact, hurling melon bits all over your windshield. It's a melon firework!
